_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The practice thatâ€™s conducive to uproo: The impermanence, suffering, and liability to fall apart of the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact
The disillusionment with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact
The disillusionment with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact
The impermanence of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind
The impermanence, suffering, and liability to fall apart of the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact
The disillusionment with the ear, nose, tongue, body, mind, thoughts, mind consciousness, and mind contact
The disillusionment with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact
The understanding that rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.
